title: a quick help needed: package compiles just fine on terminal, but not as spack package
body:
Summary
package should compile

What you expected
The package is:

```python
from spack import *
import os

class Cnvnator(Package):
    """FIXME: Put a proper description of your package here."""

    # FIXME: Add a proper url for your package's homepage here.
    homepage = "http://www.example.com"
    url      = "https://github.com/abyzovlab/CNVnator/releases/download/v0.3.3/CNVnator_v0.3.3.zip"

    version('0.3.3', 'ae87356632b1c48c89362f2796b3ae73')

    # FIXME: Add dependencies if required.
    depends_on('root')
    depends_on('zlib')

    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        os.environ['ROOTSYS'] = spec['root'].prefix
        path1 = join_path(self.stage.source_path, 'src', 'samtools')
        os.chdir(path1)
        make()
        path2 = join_path(self.stage.source_path, 'src')
        os.chdir(path2)
        make()
```
Spack installation yields errors. While compilation from terminal works:
```console
module load root..
module load zlib...

export ROOTSYS=/spack/opt/spack/linux-linuxmint18-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/root-6.08.06-6rrvrgpfubsryd5zuz3qcz754poburpl

cd ~/Downloads
wget https://github.com/abyzovlab/CNVnator/releases/download/v0.3.3/CNVnator_v0.3.3.zip
unzip CNVnator_v0.3.3.zip
cd ~/Downloads/CNVnator_v0.3.3/src/samtools
make
cd ~/Downloads/CNVnator_v0.3.3/src/
make
```

### Information on your system

This problem is not platform specific.

Linux mint 18
